About me

I'm a student of Electrical and Computer Engineering and I'm passionate about programming. I love learning and sharing my knowledge and using my knowledge to build products. In order to achieve this I have been part of HackerSchool - IST where I gave several workshops to other students on Arduino, Electronics and Programming.
My major is Computer Engineering and minor is Telecommunications. My master thesis is: "Combining Many-Objective Evolutionary Algorithms in a distributed environment using Many Objectives, Many Processors" and I love Aritificial Intelligence.

Experience

Back-end Developer

October 2016 - Present
Landing.jobs - Lisbon, PT

Built the back-end of a salary calculator application for Portugal and the UK in order to help Landing.jobs better understand their candidates and their target markets.

During this time I used the following Tech Stack: Ruby on Rails v5, Postgre SQL, SQLite3, Git, Heroku

Internship - Data Analyst

August 2016 - October 2016
Landing.jobs - Lisbon, PT

Working closely with Landing.jobs co-founder Pedro Oliveira where I did researched and analysed several different metrics in order to help Landing.jobs prepare and validate their strategies and goals.

Internship - Software Developer

July 2015 - September 2015
INESC - Lisbon, PT

Internship at Intelligent Agents and Synthetic Characters Group of Instituto Superior Técnico, where I developed an agent to compete in the Geometry Friends annual competition. Geometry Friends is a two player cooperative computer game. It is a platform game in a 2D environment with simulated physics (with gravity and friction). The goal of the players is to gather a set of diamonds in the least amount of time. In this competition the agent of me and my colleague achieved first and third place in the circle and rectangle, respectively. As a follow-up to our good results we wrote a paper that was accepted and presented at the DiGRA-FDG Conference 2016 in Dundee, Scotland.

For this project the Tech Stack was: C# and Git.

Collaborator & Vice-President

September 2013 - September 2015
HackerSchool - Lisbon, PT

Joined early on a student organisation that focuses in spreading the mindset of learn-by-doing and peer learning inspired in the values of the Maker community.

Managed a team of around 30 students where we had weekly events with an average attendance of 20 students (outside to the organization).

Gave workshop on Arduino, Electronics and Programming (Python, Java and C) to groups of people aged from 9 - 50 years old.

Set up partnerships with companies and other student organisations in order to have community events and funding for our activities and projects.

Projects

During my student career I have always had a deep interesting in trying to apply some of the concepts I learned into actual products and projects.

Student room booking - For the Internet Bases Systems Architecture Course Final Project I built a Ruby on Rails app that connects to Postgre SQL database, as one part of a project to manage student booking of rooms to study on.
Salary Calculator - While working with Landing.jobs I built a Ruby on Rails app that allows you to calculate your net salary from your gross income and allowances for the Portuguese and UK taxing system.
Geometry Friends - While interning at INESC I developed the circle agent for the game Geometry Friends, using Rapidly Exploring Random Trees.
Concurrent Web Server in C - Built a multi-threaded concurrent web server in C for the course Systems Programming of IST
Dynamic Bayesian Network Learning - Built a project for value prediction using Dynamic Bayesian Networks in Java for the Object Oriented Programming course.
